results.title: Man feeding his dogs: oil by Russell Drysdale
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “The Australian eye III”.
A small but powerful painting by Russell Drysdale, which combines starkness with lyricism. The artist talks about his reactions to the picture and his problems in painting it, and his style and technique of underpainting and glazing.

results.title: Man and woman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This film, edited from Zeffirelli’s lusty version of Shakespeare’s “Taming of the Shrew”, unfurls with great fun a Renaissance version of the spectacle known as ‘the battle of the sexes’. Stars Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor. As the commentator points out the dramatising violent conflict between men and women in search of love is one way that world literature has dealt with the relationship between the sexes.

results.title: Man and the state: the trial of Socrates
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: The trial and death of Socrates is one of the significant moments and most dramatic events in the history of Western civilization. It poses questions that are still deeply troubling to our society - how far should a society go in suppressing someone it feels is dangerously disruptive? The film draws on many Greek philosophers and touches on many facets of Greek life.

results.title: Man and the state: Machiavelli on political power
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which looks at the ideas of Niccolo Machiavelli, particularly as they are manifested in “The Prince”. These ideas are discussed in their relation to the reality of the world view that they reflect - does Machiavelli merely supply a superficial rationale to opportunists and dictators or does he present the world as it is in reality?
results.title_for_label: Man and the state: Machiavelli on political power

results.title: Man and the motor car
results.brief_description: Shows the cost of careless and drunken driving in Australia. By demonstrations, a parallel is drawn between the effects of a head-on collision at 30 mph and the result of dropping a car from a fourth-storey height. Compares road-deaths with mortality in two world wars. Points to diversion of community resources by accidents, eg hospital equipment, and panel beaters.

results.title: Man and his world: timber in Finland
results.brief_description: Depicts the timber industry in Finland, showing man as a producer and user of the technology involved. The natural highways of lakes and rivers are used to carry pulp to paper mills in Finland. The industry makes reconstruction efforts to reclaim bottom lands for the use of forestry and employs safeguards to avoid exhausting the natural resources.

results.title: Man and his world: Papua and New Guinea
results.brief_description: Explains how tribalism, remote villages and illiteracy have kept the people of Papua and New Guinea in a primitive state, and shows the beginnings of progress and development.

results.title: Man and his world: oasis in the Sahara
results.brief_description: Shows the variety of geography and the varying natural forces in the Sahara which produce the Saharan climate and weather. Describes the way of life of the inhabitants of this region. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
